item.title: 2 kids, 32 properties, 17 years w Ilse Wolfe | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description We’ve got a weapon in the building. Someone who is juggling a lot including kids, tenants, investments and clients. Ilse Wolfe from Wolfe Property Coaching helps people get started on their property journey and wants to re-teach some of the lessons (and help others avoid her mistakes) she has picked up throughout her property investment career. We dig into why this is important to her and how she got from a 9-5 role to one of the largest property owners in NZ.

item.title: ‘WTF Is Personal Branding?’ | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description Luke was recently on a panel in the accounting world about what personal branding is and what it leads to. Is it even worth it? Luke and another accountant explain the pros, cons and how to get started. This podcast won’t be for everyone but it will help some of you who may be thinking about increasing your own brand in a venture or as an individual. There are some powerful principles in here so tune in and learn.

item.title: Money Mail 188 - What version of money are you on? | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description Recently somebody asked me whether it’s a good idea to pay off their $2.5k student loan if you have $2.5k saved. Only they know that answer. But it got me thinking about the levels of money and the versions of ourselves. So I asked the old version of myself what they would do, then I asked the new version of me. Don’t have a student loan? This is just as relevant to you!

item.title: Improve Your Finances, Earn More money, Pay off Debt! w/ The High Frequency Club | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description Luke features on The High Frequency Club podcast to discuss paying off your debt, combating the rising costs of living and help alleviate your current and future money stresses. Check them out here: https://open.spotify.com/show/0wCq6F8txKy9skzoENG2fr?si=0f53784b9c3c4c60 Hey thanks for listening! Please take some form of action from this content, don’t just be a consumer, become a producer! Make sure you’re subscribed to Money Mail via Keepthechange.co.nz to receive our weekly lesson on money and financial literacy.

item.title: 50 Flips Tama Singh Quits Job & Goes ALL IN - WTF! | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description He’s back in the studio but this time he is all in. Last time he let us know that he still had a job and many people were mind blown. How the hell was he managing everything and what will be possible if this is Tama’s full focus? These are the questions we have too. We explore InvestorPro - the new App that Tama’s team have built and whether that perfect flip record is in tact with no losses to report?

item.title: Money Mail 187 - Cashing up annual leave, good or bad? | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description As money gets tight for people, I read about the different ways people are trying to put money back into their household. One of the ways people are doing this is by cashing up annual leave. This is where employees exchange some of their unused annual leave for cold hard cash. A nice cash injection! BUT what should we be thinking about before doing this? Hey thanks for listening!

item.title: Why The Hunting Season Is A Must w Mikey Smith (Guardian Smith) | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description Mikey comes in all guns blazing around why everybody needs to experience the hunting season, and no we ain’t talking about knocking over a couple of deers or goats. In this podcast we will explore what a hinting season is and how 18-36 months of your time could change your life projection. Hey thanks for listening! Please take some form of action from this content, don’t just be a consumer, become a producer!

item.description: Podcast Description Leighton Roberts CEO and co-founder of Sharesies stops by to answer your questions and several others about the journey and future of Sharesies including whether your shares are safe and how to get your kids started in investing. Hey thanks for listening! Please take some form of action from this content, don’t just be a consumer, become a producer! Make sure you’re subscribed to Money Mail via Keepthechange.co.nz to receive our weekly lesson on money and financial literacy.

item.title: Money Mail 186 - Students lose 45% of a portion of their income? | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description For those with student loans, 12% of all income above the IRD threshold ($22,828 at present) has to be repaid against the student loan. This is calculated on your gross income (before tax) not your net income / take-home income. They are feeling the pinch from the cost of living and tax brackets not moving. No wonder they are finding it hard to then save money also. Check this one out!

item.title: Housing Unaffordability Is At Its Worst? (Oct 23) w Mikey Smith (Guardian Smith) | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description Recent data from October suggests that there has never been a more unaffordable time to buy a home if you are a first-home buyer. We dig into the data to have a look at how this could be given house prices have decreased and what you need to be thinking about if you are hoping to buy soon. Hey thanks for listening! Please take some form of action from this content, don’t just be a consumer, become a producer!

item.title: Why Are People Scared To Take Risk? w Mikey Smith | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description Often I get messages from people wondering what is the best platform to buy shares on, what is the best bank to get a term deposit with, who has the best interest rates, its goes on and on. Normally, I don’t have the answers but it does get me thinking about why people are so scared to get things wrong and take risks. Is it because things have been so easy in recent history?

item.title: What The New Govt Means For You & I? w Mikey Smith (Guardian Smith) | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description We finally have a confirmed new government and Mikey takes us through some of the changes that we might expect in the coming years. What will this mean for you and what do you need to focus on? Let’s have a look. Hey thanks for listening! Please take some form of action from this content, don’t just be a consumer, become a producer! Make sure you’re subscribed to Money Mail via Keepthechange.

item.title: Money Mail 185 - ‘We sold the forever home’ | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description [Hey bro, today we did it!! Unconditionally sold our “forever home” We were $1m in the hole(debt) paying crook interest mate ($70,000pa).] I received this thought provoking message from a reader. I thought this one might interest you. What decisions did you make at 2% interest rates that you wouldn’t have made at 6 or 7% interest? Hey thanks for listening! item.description: Podcast Description My partner came to me and said that the listeners need to know a bit more about my softer side and some of the things you may not know about me. She sits me down with a stack of questions and fired them at me. Hopefully there are some lessons in here and no doubt some ins gith to the way I think about things. Hey thanks for listening!

item.title: Money Mail 184 - Are kiwis getting poorer? | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description Stats NZ has recently released updated data on kiwi households’ net worth. To the end of the June quarter, NZ has a total of $2177billion in combined household net worth. At the height of the asset(s) bubble and before things started to really turn the other way, the total household net worth was around $2432billion. Where’s it all gone? Hey thanks for listening! Please take some form of action from this content, don’t just be a consumer, become a producer!

item.description: Podcast Description Have you heard the story background story of Siya Kolisi, an inspiration. The South African Rugby Wolrd Cup winning captain explains a bit about his journey in a keynote that I thought may inspire a number of you. Enjoy. Hey thanks for listening! item.description: Podcast Description Apparently it’s smart to diversify when it comes to investing. What does that even mean? And how do we think about this for our individual situations given they are so different? Rupert Carlyon is here to explain another complex topic and make it sound simple. Get diversified. Hey thanks for listening! Please take some form of action from this content, don’t just be a consumer, become a producer! Make sure you’re subscribed to Money Mail via Keepthechange.

item.description: Podcast Description I got a bit of a fright last week when I logged into Sharesies and saw one of my stocks had increased by 60%. I refreshed the page a couple of times to make sure there wasn’t a minus sign that had failed to load. But no, legit, 60% gains baby! So what happened? Hey thanks for listening! item.title: Did The Boomers Have It All? w Mikey Smith | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description People often joke that the boomers had it easy when it comes to the housing market but did they really? What about all the things that we have in the modern day that they didn’t have. This podcast is inspired by a listener request, if you’d like to send in your request please do so. Enjoy Hey thanks for listening! Please take some form of action from this content, don’t just be a consumer, become a producer!

item.title: Edwards & Co 100x Their Pram Sales w Mark Edwards | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description 2023 EY entrepreneur of the year finalist Mark Edwards joins us to explain how an idea turned into selling 100 prams in year one and now more than 10,000 a year. The story of Edwards and Co’s growth including the ups and downs. Hey thanks for listening! Please take some form of action from this content, don’t just be a consumer, become a producer! item.title: Money Mail 182 - Why do people need to lose their jobs? | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description The unemployment rate has risen to 3.9% from 3.6% last quarter. It’s slowly increasing. Often people ask why we would want unemployment to increase? Shouldn’t we want more people working? Statistics NZ tells us that 118,000 people are currently unemployed. Why would we want this number to increase? Let’s try and figure it out. Hey thanks for listening! Please take some form of action from this content, don’t just be a consumer, become a producer!

item.title: Productivity - How Big Of An Issue? w Rupert (Kōura Wealth) | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description The big P word that people talk about but no one ever explains. I sit down with Rupert Carlyon who has been publishing a lot of information in this space so that we can understand it better AND think about what our country could look like if we took it more seriously. Since we probably won’t, we get stuck into ways as individuals we can be thinking about this important concept.

item.title: Do You Deserve It? (Hard Conversation!) w Mikey Smith | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description Mikey comes in with an absolute banger of a topic around when you deserve the things that you want in your life. This is a very tricky conversation for a lot of us and we give some real examples that have happened recently to help you understand the topic. Enjoy! Hey thanks for listening! Please take some form of action from this content, don’t just be a consumer, become a producer!

item.title: Money Mail 181 - WANTED: Dead Or Alive: Bitcoin | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description You might be surprised to know that bitcoin is up over 100% this year alone. Wait what? By the time you get to this, yes there could be a wild swing in the price and that % may not be accurate but, at the time of writing this, bitcoin is still doing its thing. Where has all the hype gone and what do we need to know about Bitcoin?

item.title: Risking It All In Property Development w Curtis McCorquindale (Queenwood Property) | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description Imagine having an interest in property development and then randomly buying a section and figuring out how to develop it. Well that’s what Curtis did. Curtis sits down to share his journey including what he would do differently and how if it wasn’t for his hustle + resourcefulness he may be back in employment. A great example of the will to succeed. Enjoy! Hey thanks for listening! Please take some form of action from this content, don’t just be a consumer, become a producer!

item.title: Money Mail 180 - Do Young People Understand Inflation? | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description 58% of Gen Z got this question about inflation wrong. 51% of Millennials got it wrong too. Only 18% of Baby Boomers got it wrong. So what is the question and how come the young people are getting it wrong? Recent inflation data out of New Zealand reminds us that we really need to understand the thief stealing our purchasing power so let’s dive in and get a refresh.

item.title: REVEALED: What Each Age Bracket Makes w Mikey Smith | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description We dig into some recent data from Statistics New Zealand about different age brackets in New Zealand and the median income. You may be surprised to know and this may get you thinking about where you sit and where you would like to sit and think about increasing your income as always and building value into yourself so that you can beat the statistics if that’s your thing.

item.title: How To Network w Mikey Smith | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description On the back of the success of the “How To Approach Someone” podcast it is time to look at helping you introverts on a bit of networking. There are no excuses here and you can learn some frameworks to help you network at those pesky events that you were skied to go to. This is a number one resource to help you overcome the fear of networking with str.

item.title: Money Mail 179 - ‘I’ve got an idea’ - oh do you now? | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description We’ve all got an idea or two. I’e had a tonne over the years myself and most I have done nothing with. We know that ideas are sh!t without execution. So how do we think about validating our ideas and getting them going? Why does it seem so hard? And why are we doing it in the first place? Let’s get executing Hey thanks for listening! Please take some form of action from this content, don’t just be a consumer, become a producer!

item.title: All Things Crypto Tax With Ex IRD Investigator Jodi Collinge JCTAX.co.nz | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description A big scoop here as we get an ex-IRD investigator from the crypto team to sit down and teach us about all of the misunderstandings when it comes to cryptocurrency and why many Kiwis may not be meeting their correct tax obligations. You crypto lovers will enjoy this one. Hey thanks for listening! Please take some form of action from this content, don’t just be a consumer, become a producer!

item.title: What If Australia Wasn't There? w Mikey Smith | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description Have you ever wondered what New Zealand would be like if Australia wasn’t so close and wasn’t there at all? At the moment plenty of people are moving to Australia for a larger income and better lifestyle but what if that wasn’t an option what would you do then? Hey thanks for listening! Please take some form of action from this content, don’t just be a consumer, become a producer!

item.title: Money Mail 178 - Your Will: The Most Overlooked Decision of Your Life? | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description In 2022 I had to do some real ‘adult sh!t’. That is never fun, is it? The kind of stuff most of us will avoid because it’s a bit scary. Or, like all good humans, we will do it when we are ‘forced to’. I started thinking about my death. I know Kereen I know that is some morbid chat. I apologise, but apparently I have a 100% chance of dying in my lifetime, so I thought I had better tidy up some admin in this space.

item.title: Who Believed In You? MUST Listen w Mikey Smith | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description Luke recalls being very lucky in early life to have many people share their belief in him and he explains this and how this has really benefitted him. We dive into a story from a KTC listener around a surprising figure who believed in them and how this now shaoed the way they see themselves. So the question for you is who believed in you and who can you pass on some belief to?

item.title: Money Mail 177 - REVEALED: What I Did Last Election | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description Last week I received hundreds of dollars in dividends. Sick brag I know! 3 years ago, when everyone was last heading for the polls, I didn’t have the $8k invested that generated those hundreds of dollars of dividends. Don’t ignore the principle just because you don’t have $8,000 right now. What about when you do? Hey thanks for listening! Please take some form of action from this content, don’t just be a consumer, become a producer!

item.description: Podcast Description A fair bit of travel recently! This is a quick recount of some of the things Luke noticed when traveling through either Singapore Bali or Sydney and how travel always seems to get your mind looking at things in a different way and seeing what is happening out of your own environment. Hey thanks for listening! Please take some form of action from this content, don’t just be a consumer, become a producer!

item.title: I Give 22yo Dangerous Life Advice, 3 Years Later He Returns w Jono Lloyd West | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description Three years ago a young lad came to me and sought some guidance on a situation they were faced with. I gave them some potentially risky and dangerous life advice that I knew they could handle and three years later they come back to tell me how that advice has played out and where they are now. Hey thanks for listening! Please take some form of action from this content, don’t just be a consumer, become a producer!

item.title: Are House Prices Roaring Again? (Sept 2023) w Mikey Smith | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description There’s a lot of talk that we have gone well past the bottom of the housing market so have we? Mikey and Luke take a look at recent changes in the housing market and where things could go from here. Hey thanks for listening! Please take some form of action from this content, don’t just be a consumer, become a producer! Make sure you’re subscribed to Money Mail via Keepthechange.

item.title: Money Mail 176 - Recession Over! Why Doesn’t It Feel Like It? | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description This weeks Gross Domestic Product data told us that we are out of a recession. The economy is growing. It might only be slightly, but growth is what we are focussed on and how we gauge whether we are in a recession or not. For many of us, it probably doesn’t feel like that. So how come? Let’s try and work it out Hey thanks for listening! Please take some form of action from this content, don’t just be a consumer, become a producer!

item.title: Money Mail 175 - Live Like A King On $40k A Year | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description I made it out of Bali alive! What an amazing country. Our dollar is worth $9,000 of theirs so it goes a bit further. Travel really gets you thinking about things you say, believe and do. A really eye opening trip and I take you through some of the things I picked up on. Enjoy! Hey thanks for listening! Please take some form of action from this content, don’t just be a consumer, become a producer!

item.title: Money Mail 174 - NZ's ‘Cost Of Inaction’ Crisis | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description Want more money in your back pocket? Well, don’t wait for an election. In October, hundreds of thousands of kiwis (possibly even millions) are going to vote PURELY based on what cash they’ll get in their wallet. BUT you don’t need to wait, there is a stack of money sitting right in front of you. If only you’d take action. Let’s take some and find you some $$$

item.title: Money & Relationships(we go there) w Lynda Moore (Money Mentalist) | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description Strap yourselves in and if you’re brave enough, listen to this with your partner in the same room. I sit down with Lynda Moore from https://moneymentalist.com to discuss some of the differences between men and women when it comes to money and provide a few confessions of my own. Lynda explains how money can be one of the leading causes of the demise of our relationships so how can we bring it up with a partner?

item.title: What Is Your Money Personality? w Lynda Moore (Money Mentalist) | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description What are the different types of money personalities and where do they even come from? I sit down with Lynda Moore from https://moneymentalist.com to explore why we do some of the things we do, why we are so scared to talk about money and what beliefs may not be serving us too well. Lynda’s Money Mentalist Programmes help kiwis re-write their beliefs about money and put them on the path to financial freedom.

item.title: How To Make $100k Online w @JoshRyan | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description In the second podcast with Josh Ryan, I tasked him with helping us to think about how we could make $100,000 online. Most kiwis will never hit the $100,000 income level, but Josh has and he has done it online by 23 so he is the perfect person to ask. If earning $100,000 isn’t your thing that’s fine too because I ask Josh some of the principles we could be applying to helping us grow our social media presence.

item.title: Mind Traps You Need To Avoid Part 2 w Mikey Smith | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description Here it is, the part two of the series around understanding mind traps to avoid. These come from two great YouTube videos that break down the different mind each and every single one of us will experience day to day in our life. The more you understand these the more you will see them and potentially avoid the pitfalls from them and potentially also use them to your advantage where possible.

item.title: 2 Ticks You ✅✅ Beat any political parties promises | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description How to beat any political parties promises! With the upcoming election promising to be a little bit of a cash lolly scramble to secure your vote, I wanted to remind you how powerful you are and how there may be more available to you ALREADY than you realise. Why wait for an election, 31 March or 1 July when you could implement some of these tactics yourself? Let’s get stuck into them.

item.title: No degree, debt free, top earning kiwi @JoshRyan | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description I sit down with Josh Ryan, who helps people grow their Instagram and YouTube channels so that they can make more money. They pay him money to do this. Find out about what it’s like, building a business from scratch when all your mates head to uni. Josh got into this straight out of high school and has been doing it for 8 years. What can you learn from this trailblazer?

item.title: REVEALED How (Much) Mikey Gets Paid w Mikey Smith | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description There are a number of different ways to make income in this country and there are also a number of different forms of income so in this podcast we start by exploring how Mikey gets paid as a mortgage adviser and how some of his income can actually be an asset that can be sold. You will definitely learn something in this and have your eyes opened so get stuck in.

item.title: Money Mail 173 - The ABCs of Depreciation | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description There’s been a bit of talk recently about depreciation on commercial buildings. This is because two of the major political parties will remove this as a tax-deductible expense after the election. Put simply; depreciation reflects the decrease in value of an asset over time. Well what about rental properties and how does this impact you? Let’s learn and explore depreciation. Hey thanks for listening! Please take some form of action from this content, don’t just be a consumer, become a producer!

item.title: TRIGGER - Can You Afford That Pussy? | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description wow oh we are really going to do this! There’s been a lot of chat recently around when the right season is to have a pet so in this episode we will explore Mikey’s true cost of his pussy and the number of things we often don’t think about when taking on a massive commitment like a pet. Please understand that yes we know you may have different reasons for having pets and that is completely fine we are not here to tell you what to do everybody can make their own decisions for you.

item.title: 'Why Is Paying Down Debt Sexier Then Saving?' w Mikey Smith | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description In this podcast we address a question that we have been asked about ‘why paying down debt can feel more enjoyable than saving?’. We take a look at some of the ways we may be conditioned to think about spending and taking on debt and ways to make saving more exciting including revealing some of the ways we are doing that and the outcomes from that. Hey thanks for listening!

item.title: Money Mail 172 - I don’t pay all my bills | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description Ahhh passive Income - you either desire it or believe it to be full of sh!t. We’ve all had dreams of sitting on a beach, paying for cocktails from the interest earnt on our lotto winnings. OR having 4 rental properties, collecting the rent and doing the same, but probably just on Himitangi beach rather than a Hawaiian one. BUT a lot of can understand passive income whilst interest rates are higher so let’s take a look at some examples.

item.title: Wow! Kiwis Are Rich $$$ w Mikey Smith | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description In a recent report from Credit Suisse, it details how Kiwis are a lot richer than you may expect. Did you know that we have hundreds of thousands of Kiwis in the top 1% of worldwide wealth? We also have millions of Kiwis in the top 10% of worldwide wealth. So why do you feel so poor? Let’s take a look. Hey thanks for listening! Please take some form of action from this content, don’t just be a consumer, become a producer!

item.title: August 2023 OCR Surprises w Mikey Smith | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description So the latest official cash rate announcement has been and there has again been no change in the OCR. However, in this announcement, there were a couple of surprises so we dig into those and see what the reserve bank was trying to tell us at this announcement. Hey thanks for listening! Please take some form of action from this content, don’t just be a consumer, become a producer!

item.title: Money Mail 171 - I made $50k in July | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description In July, we locked in over $50,000 worth of work directly from the Keep The Change audience. Last week we spoke about the concept of investing in yourself and how it’s the best investment to make. Many successful people say things like that. People also say that if you follow your passion, the money will come. July is proof of that for me. BUT look at how long that has taken and how much effort.

item.title: HOW To Approach Someone w Mikey Smith (GuardianSmith.co.nz) | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description Luke gets a rogue email from someone wanting a job, who won’t be getting a job. item.description: Podcast Description There are now thousands of supercars on the roads in NZ, we look at some numbers from back in 2000 through to today to see how this has changed and whether it is a good thing or bad thing, as well as how it’s all been funded. Hey thanks for listening! Please take some form of action from this content, don’t just be a consumer, become a producer! Make sure you’re subscribed to Money Mail via Keepthechange.

item.title: Money Mail 170 - Did your education cost you your belief? | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description ‘’Invest in yourself’’, ‘’The best investment you can make is in yourself!’’. We’ve all heard these sayings but not everyone is interested in this. These sayings are almost thrown around so much that I don’t think people believe it to be true anymore. I got me thinking, why? Because so many smart, wealthy, happy and experienced people say things like this. Hey thanks for listening! Please take some form of action from this content, don’t just be a consumer, become a producer!

item.title: WEBINAR: The 10 Commandments Of Building Wealth w Lighthouse Financial | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description Join James Blair from Lighthouse Financial for an interactive webinar where we go through the fundamental wealth principles you need to know to successfully start on your wealth creation journey.This webinar is all about the psychological concepts you need to understand to become financially bulletproof.The 10 commandments:Understand your motivation for wealth creationPlans are nothing, planning is everythingNever spend more than what you earnMake your money work harder than youKnow how you can benefit from the power of compoundingKnow how to implement leverageGive your investments sufficient time to growDo not compare your wealth goals to that of peersGive more value than you takeTreat your wealth like a business (because it is)Hey thanks for listening!

item.title: You Bought Your House Now Live In It (Sorry!) w Mikey Smith (GuardianSmith.co.nz) | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description A recent Keep The Change Instagram poll revealed that a lot of people are questioning their recent decisions to buy a property. In this podcast we review why you didn’t have the info that you have now and how your thinking could be very normal. Perhaps you have buyer’s remorse but zoom out and think longer term. Hey thanks for listening!

item.title: Money Mail 97 - Investing? Need to consider taxes? | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description Most people buy shares hoping for a capital gain and we do not currently have a capital gains tax in New Zealand. Shares are usually a capital asset and any gains the seller gets on the share sale are non-taxable income (as long as the shares were held with the intention of a long-term investment). But what about dividends? Chances are the IRD already know about some of these.

item.title: Money Mail 93 - I lost $37k in investments in January | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description We spoke briefly about how January wasn’t very flash for investors. On the 31st of January I was brave enough to pull up my Financial Position. $37k of networth gone! Crypto, stocks, kiwisaver, sharesies, it had all sh!t the bed to put it politely. This is a time for logic, not emotion. Hey thanks for listening! Please take some form of action from this content, don’t just be a consumer, become a producer!

item.title: Money Mail 92 - The cost of travel for you | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description On the weekend, I was giving someone a hand with their finances and we noticed something pretty alarming. The cost of petrol and parking for them was over 10% of their total salary. We know from recent data that transport was the second biggest contributor to inflation for 2021. Statistics New Zealand said during last year the average price of 91 octane petrol increased 30%, from $1.87 per litre to $2.

item.title: What's Going On Out There? | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description What’s going on? item.title: Money Mail 91 - I gambled $660k of people's money 😱 | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description If you haven’t bumped into my passion project ‘Boys Get Paid’, you might find this subject line very confusing. Two Saturdays ago we hosted an event for 850 people. We also run a ‘punters club’ where we pool everyone’s money and bet it on behalf of everyone on the night. We had over 7,500 people deposit money from all over the country (and a few Aussies). This was the 5th year of doing this and we wanted to set a target for a pool of $500,000.

item.title: Money Mail 90 - Are Your Assets Performing? | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description From time to time, I will go through the assets that I own and I will question myself about whether they are performing. Buy and hold is a great simplistic strategy, but sometimes, things can change and sometimes our tactics need to change as the world does. We discuss getting clear on thinking about the purpose for purchasing any type of asset. Hey thanks for listening! Please take some form of action from this content, don’t just be a consumer, become a producer!

item.title: Money Mail 89 - [Activity] Analyse your life's costs | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description Lately, we’ve been talking about prices going up and most people are probably just skimming past it thinking it doesn’t apply too much to them. I’ve put together a practical exercise you can do over the weekend. If you are brave enough, you need to look at EVERY cost in your life. This isn’t fun, but neither is not sleeping or worrying about money, so get this done.

item.title: Money Mail 88 - Your network is your net worth (apparently) | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description Have you heard this saying before: ‘Your network is your net worth’? From what I have seen (as much as we might not like it), these sayings are very true and we will all see this playout throughout our lives and probably even use these sayings. Sometimes these things can work for us and other times against us. Ultimately, you need to build connections over time so that you can get these things working for you.

item.description: Podcast Description Last week we were talking about the vehicle we are in and whether that is going to make it when it comes to taking us to our desired destination of financial goals. I want to tell you a story about one of my best mates. He recently sent through a screenshot of shares that he owns and they had gone past one million dollars in total. This isn’t a sharesies account.

item.title: Money Mail 83 - Huge pay cuts for a number of Kiwis in 2022 | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description The pay decrease - the increase in interest paid to the bank leading to less money left in the household for spending. Kiwis are obsessed with ‘locking in’ the best interest rate and playing the ‘will they go up or down’ game. In 2022 this means billions & billions (fair bit more than lotto) of dollars of debt will roll off their current locked in interest rates. Hey thanks for listening!

item.title: Money Mail 82 - Will house prices really go down in 2022? | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description Economists at three of the four largest banks see house prices dropping in 2022. The average value of NZ homes increased by $17,227 in November. The average value is now $987,401, according to the CoreLogic House Price Index. Over the year to the end of November, the average value of New Zealand homes is up $218,388. Hey thanks for listening! item.description: Podcast Description Ahh the ole term deposit. What are they? A term deposit is a type of deposit account usually held at a bank, where the money is locked up for a set period of time and returns a set interest rate. Today we are going to look at whether you can get your money out early? Hey thanks for listening! Please take some form of action from this content, don’t just be a consumer, become a producer!

item.title: Money Mail 79 - Moving a credit card to 0% interest | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description This week we are going to carry on the theme of debt and have a look at using a credit card balance transfer. If used properly a balance transfer can be an effective way of quickly paying down debt, but first, you will want to ensure you understand how it works, as the interest rate that kicks in can be brutal! Hey thanks for listening! Please take some form of action from this content, don’t just be a consumer, become a producer!

item.title: Money Mail 78 - To Pay Off My Student Loan? | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description We’ve briefly spoke about how an interest-free student loan could be a good thing right now. Especially with inflation here. Many people with a student loan (or any form of interest-free debt) are sitting there thinking what is the point of paying this off in a hurry if it’s not really costing me anything in terms of interest? A good question, although there may be ways in which it will affect you financially down the track if you’re not careful.

item.title: Money Mail 77 - Inflation...the good, bad & the yucky | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description Last year, we talked about how you and I were going to get taxed in the form of inflation and it is here, BIG TIME! Statistics NZ tells us that annual inflation jumped to 4.9% in the September quarter. This is the highest level of inflation we have seen in over 10 years. Inflation is worth understanding and thinking about for all of us because we can take actions to combat it.

item.title: Money Mail 76 - 365 days on from my first bitcoin buy | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description Today is exactly one year on since I made my first bitcoin purchase. The $3,300 is now worth $15,100. Pretty decent return, huh? An $11,800 unrealised gain. I haven’t sold it, so as you know, this is an ‘unrealised gain’. It would only become a realised gain if I were to sell & bank the profits (which I would pay tax on). It’s a great feeling. You probably think that it’s a great feeling due to the fact that I’ve made $11,800 on paper?

item.title: Bitcoin Highs + Inflation + Auckland | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description Bonus Episode! If you’ve been tapped in you would know inflation is likely to go up 5%. item.title: Money Mail 75 - Unclaimed Money...are you owed anything? | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description Did you know: As at November 2019, there was an estimated $199 million of unclaimed money in the Crown’s accounts. Unclaimed money is money left untouched by its owner in organisations like banks, insurance companies, power companies or an old employer. It is usually amounts over $100. Hey thanks for listening! Please take some form of action from this content, don’t just be a consumer, become a producer! Make sure you’re subscribed to Money Mail via Keepthechange.

item.description: Podcast Description Start by writing down all of your debt and eyeball it. Actually, come to terms with the debt that you have (this is why I suggest completing your financial position monthly). Rank your debt in order of importance. The most important may not be the largest. It is most probably the debt with the highest interest rate. Hey thanks for listening! item.description: Podcast Description Coming to you on this beautiful Level 3 Friday during mental health awareness week. Surely we’ve all had that feeling at some point in our lives where we just think all of the solutions seem too practical & they are going to take too long. It stops us from even starting. What’s the point? Hey thanks for listening! Please take some form of action from this content, don’t just be a consumer, become a producer!

item.title: Money Mail 72 - How big shocks sneak up on us | Keep The Change
item.description: Podcast Description There were huge concerns that an Evergrande property bust in China could cause a worldwide ripple impacting all markets. This has been brewing for months, and really for those researching close enough, years. This is often how these big shocks sneak up on us. We aren’t awake to the fact that risk is just around the corner. We are busy doing our day-to-day lives and all of a sudden it seems to just come out of nowhere.
